nodes.text: Ah, Mr. O'Conner! Have you come to play a few games with us?
Caesari is rather disappointed in you, Mr. O'Conner.
We were hoping that you could make it here tonight, Mr. O'Conner. I trust your meeting with Mr. Terk was not too unpleasant...
Ah, Mr. O'Conner... I hope that you enjoyed the Poobah game the other night. I would be most saddened to learn that we scared you away from our company here.
Good evening, Mr. O'Conner.
I cannot believe all this brouhaha over a petty pilferer... As if a true thief would stoop to stealing towels or purloining pens!
It is a relief that this stupid 'school thief' incident is finally over, is it not?
Would you like to recover from today's exam with a friendly game of Poobah?
The midterm break is rapidly approaching, Mr. O'Conner. Do you have any plans for spending it?
Ah, good evening, Mr. O'Conner. Things are a bit... tense... here tonight. I do hope the Poobah game starts soon.
Over the midterm break, I heard a story about the Raven that you might be interested in hearing.
These Drats running through the school everywhere are most unpleasant. <sigh> At least Mr. Terk cannot blame our class for this particular mess.
Shall we give Caesari a lesson in Poobah tonight?
How strange to think that this semester of Hero-U will soon be over...
Our last Poobah game... This should be interesting, no?
Shall we start the game of Poobah?
Indeed, that is an excellent suggestion.
Would you like to play Darts with me?
Perhaps I would like to play... if you are willing to make the game more interesting by wagering a Lyra on the outcome. I play better when there is money at stake.
I'll even give you three to one odds. You risk only one Lyra... and if you win, you will gain three Lyra. The odds are indeed in your favor.
Sure, I'll take that bet.
Yes. I'll...
Wait... oh... I don't have enough money to risk a bet.
That is most sad. I hope you will be able to come across some more Lyra soon. Then perhaps we can play darts together.
I don't think so. I don't like wasting money on a silly game.
Oh well, we do not need to play then.
I will be most pleased to play darts with you... assuming that you are willing to risk a mere one Lyra in hopes of winning three.
Sure. Why not?
Sorry, I'm broke right now.
Perhaps another time, we shall play.

nodes.message: Play with Joel when less than four losses... no wager yet

nodes.text: I would very much enjoy playing a game with you, Mr. O'Conner.
Forgive me, but you are far better at the game than I am. You are better off challenging Esme rather than myself.

nodes.message: Joel doesn't track non-money game losses - he's sandbagging.

nodes.text: You're very good at this game. Congratulations.
Well played, Mr. O'Conner. We shall all need to watch out for you.
You played very well. I'm afraid that I cannot match your talent with darts.
I am afraid that you will need to find a better opponent at this game from now on. You are too good.
Once again, nicely played... I believe that I owe you five Lyra. Here you are.
It seems that my darts do not throw as straight as yours do. Here is the five Lyra that I wagered... And I do hope that we can play another time so that I can regain my money.
You almost beat me that time. However, I believe you owe me a Lyra, no?
Well played! You are nearly as skilled at this game as I am, Mr. O'Conner. Perhaps you will win the next time we throw the darts. For now, I believe you owe me 1 Lyra.
Ah, very good try, you had me quaking in my boots. But alas, it seems that you owe me 1 Lyra.
Thank you. I look forward to our next game.
You are getting very good at this game... Perhaps we should have a little wager on the outcome the next time we play?
I'll even make the odds in your favor. You will only need to risk one Lyra, and if you win, you will gain three Lyra. That will be much more entertaining, no?
Well played! You are nearly as skilled at this game as I am, Mr. O'Conner. Perhaps you will win the next time we throw the darts.
Would you like to play a round of Pool with me?
Yes... if you are willing to wager a mere five Lyra. If you win, however, I will give you ten Lyra. Most excellent odds, are they not?
Sure, that sounds like the odds are in my favor.
I'd love to take that bet...
But I'm afraid I don't have the Lyra to wager right now.
Perhaps we can play another time, then.
Sorry, I don't care for gambling.
That is a pity. Perhaps we can play another time.
Yes, indeed. Shall we wager again? You stand to win ten Lyra, after all.
Let's do this.
Sorry, no can do.
I would very much enjoy playing a game with you, Mr. O'Conner.
You are too good for me now, my friend. Perhaps Caesari would be a better match for your talents.

nodes.message: Joel ignores Shawn's victories when no money at stake

nodes.text: Most impressive, Mr. O'Conner.
Well played, Mr. O'Conner. You are at least a match for me.
Good game, sir. I look forward to our next match.
I believe I owe you another 10 Lyra...
I am very sorry to have to admit, but your skills at Pool far exceeds my own, Shawn. I prefer to play a game where I have a chance to win.
Let us not play this game again together. I am sure that Sosi would provide more challenge for you at the game than I do.
Hmmmm. You are much better than I had expected. It would appear that I owe you ten Lyra.
Very well played! Alas, it seems that my purse will be ten Lyra lighter. We shall have to play another time so that I can recoup my loss.
Good game, you almost had me. However, I believe you owe me 5 Lyra, no?
Well played! You are nearly as skilled at billiards as I am, Mr. O'Conner. For now, however, I believe you owe me 5 Lyra.
That was a very challenging match. I shall regretfully accept the five Lyra you owe me.
Thank you. I'm sure you will do better next time we play.

Perhaps we can make this more interesting a challenge by wagering on the outcome next time. I will be happy to give you 2 to 1 odds. If I win, you only forfeit five Lyra. However, if I lose, you will gain ten Lyra. A very good deal, no?
You show a great deal of promise at this game, Mr. O'Conner. You will be quite a challenge.
Would you like to play Cards with me?
Of course... assuming you will put some money on the line for it. You need risk a mere 10 Lyra. If you win, however, I will give you forty Lyra. The odds are very much in your favor.
Why not? I can always use the money.
Sorry, but I don't have enough money to risk on a bet.
Perhaps we can play another time, then.
No thanks.
Alas, I do enjoy playing with you. Perhaps another time then.
Yes, indeed. Shall we wager again? You could win forty Lyra.
Sure... deal some cards.
Eh, I'm nearly broke. Maybe another time.
It shall be very entertaining to play cards with you.
It would seem as if you are the master of this game, Shawn. Your card skills exceed my own.

nodes.message: Joel ignores Shawn's victories when no money at stake

nodes.text: You are a quick learner. You win this game.
Well played, Mr. O'Conner. You are at least a match for me.
Good game, sir. I look forward to our next match.
That was very cleverly played, Shawn.
You are as good at manipulating the cards as I am. There is little point to playing you now.
I really don't like losing. However, I could not lose to a better person than you, Shawn. Just don't expect me to want to play you again.
Odd. I thought that the ace had been already played. I don't usually lose count like that. However, I clearly owe you forty Lyra.
Congratulations! I am not often outplayed... and yet, you won. Here are the forty Lyra for our gentlemanly bet.
Perhaps when you are a little luckier, you will defeat me. That will be 10 Lyra, please.
Well played... and such a close game. However, I believe you owe me ten Lyra, do you not?
You are a very clever opponent, Mr. O'Conner. Perhaps you will win the next time we play. For now, I am afraid I must insist you pay me the 10 Lyra bet.
I see you have mastered the basics. Once you learn some advanced skills, I am sure you will take back your 10 Lyra and much more.
You are quite a challenge at cards. Why don't we make this more interesting by having a friendly little wager the next time we play, shall we?
If you are willing to gamble with ten Lyra, then I will wager forty in return. You could win a tidy little sum on our next game... And I am looking forward to playing that game with you.
That sounds like a good deal for me.
You show a great deal of promise at this game, Mr. O'Conner. You will be quite a challenge at the Poobah table.
